arts.ttl: Claudio Ranieri Offers Update on Roma Future After Genoa Triumph
arts.sum: Roma manager Claudio Ranieri addressed the media after Friday night's comfortable 3-1 home triumph against Genoa. The Giallorossi delivered another emphatic performance at the Stadio Olimpico to climb to ninth in the Serie A standings amid a five-match unbeaten run. The post Claudio Ranieri Offers Update on Roma Future After Genoa Triumph appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Fiorentina Explore Potential Move for Bryan Cristante
arts.sum: As the winter transfer window progresses, Fiorentina have initiated inquiries regarding Bryan Cristante, the Roma midfielder. The club, under the management of Raffaele Palladino, are considering a strategic move to bolster their midfield options with the addition of the 29-year-old player. The post Fiorentina Explore Potential Move for Bryan Cristante appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Roma 3-1 Genoa: Match Report
arts.sum: Roma triumphed 3-1 over Genoa, ending Patrick Vieira's unbeaten away record. The victory featured notable contributions from Artem Dovbyk, who scored a close-range tap-in, and Stephan El Shaarawy, who netted a stunning goal on his 300th appearance for the club. The post Serie A | Roma 3-1 Genoa: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Ranieri: “I Will Leave Roma at the End of the Season, They Are Looking For a New Coach”
arts.sum: As the Serie A season progresses, Roma's coach Claudio Ranieri has made headlines with his recent statements regarding his future and the club's search for a new manager. Ranieri, who has been brought back to stabilize the team after a disappointing start under previous management, will be a guest on the Rai Due show "Dribbling" on January 18. The post Ranieri: “I Will Leave Roma at the End of the Season, They Are Looking For a New Coach” appeared first on FootItalia.com.
